Stock Tracker Viz
- Single-file Python 3 script using only standard library (tkinter, matplotlib, json, datetime, random, math).
- Main window: 1920x1080 responsive grid layout (using pack/grid with weights); auto dark/light theme based on system time (dark after 18:00 UTC).
- Top toolbar: Entry for new stock symbol (e.g. "AAPL"), Add button, Clear All button, Export JSON button.
- Left panel (40% width): Stock list as clickable Listbox (shows symbol + current price); right-click menu: Edit Price, Delete.
- Center panel (60% width): Live line chart (matplotlib embedded via FigureCanvasTkAgg) showing price history (30 points max per stock).
- Data model: Dict of stocks {symbol: [price_history_list]}, persists to 'stocks.json' (load on start, auto-save every 30s or on changes).
- Simulation: On add, generate 30 random prices (base 100-200, ±5% volatility); auto-update all prices every 5s in background thread.
- Undo/Redo: Stack-based (Ctrl+Z/Y); supports add/edit/delete/reprice actions (max 50 steps).
- Chart features: Zoom (mouse drag), pan (middle-drag), hover tooltips (symbol/price/date), multi-line toggle (checkboxes in legend).
- Keyboard: Arrow keys navigate listbox, Enter edits selected, Delete removes, Tab cycles focus.
- Responsive: Resize handler scales chart/panels; min window 800x600.
- Colors: Light (white bg, navy lines), Dark (darkgray bg, cyan lines); smooth 1s fade transition.
- Testable: Run script → Add "MSFT" (102.5), "GOOG" (145.2) → Watch auto-updates → Undo adds → Export/verify JSON → Resize/zoom chart.
- Edge cases: Empty list shows "Add stocks to visualize", error popup for invalid JSON, thread-safe updates via queue.
